title: Introducing apps in ChatGPT and the new Apps SDK
optimized_headline: "Explore ChatGPT's New Apps SDK: Transforming User Experience with Innovative Tools"
raw_excerpt: We’re introducing a new generation of apps you can chat with, right inside ChatGPT. Developers can start building them today with the new Apps SDK, available in preview.
raw_body: We’re introducing a new generation of apps you can chat with, right inside ChatGPT. Developers can start building them today with the new Apps SDK, available in preview.
speedrun: OpenAI has launched a new Apps SDK for ChatGPT, enabling developers to create interactive apps that users can chat with directly. This SDK is currently available in preview, allowing for immediate experimentation and development. The introduction of these apps could enhance user engagement by making interactions more dynamic and personalized. This development matters now as it opens up new possibilities for integrating AI into everyday tasks.
why_it_matters: Developers can now create customized apps that enhance user experience within ChatGPT, benefiting both creators and users alike.
This move signals a shift towards more interactive AI applications, potentially changing how people engage with technology in their daily lives.

lenses.eli12: OpenAI has made it easier for developers to create apps that you can interact with through ChatGPT. Think of it like having a conversation with a helpful assistant that can do various tasks for you. This is important because it could make using AI more accessible and fun for everyone.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, this new Apps SDK represents a chance to meet user needs for more interactive experiences. By integrating these apps, businesses could improve efficiency and engagement. It’s a practical opportunity to enhance offerings and differentiate in a competitive market.
lenses.engineer: The new Apps SDK allows developers to build chat-enabled applications within ChatGPT, enhancing its functionality. This could lead to more personalized user experiences, as developers can tailor interactions based on user input. The SDK’s preview status indicates that it’s still evolving, which may require ongoing adjustments from developers.
